body: Can you post your code, the stack traces you're getting, the ORT version & Java version?

That error message is because the model expects floats and you're passing it in a byte array. It's also passing in a 1-d byte array, as the `createTensor(OrtEnvironment, Object)` overload you are using infers the shape from the array. You can either use a multidimensional float array (which will be very slow), or write the values to a `java.nio.FloatBuffer` and use the `OnnxTensor.createTensor(OrtEnvironment, FloatBuffer, long[])` overload which allows you to supply a shape.
Thank you for the help, it worked!!
